result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery M Schwartz
Current: W243 N6601 W. Haven Dr., Sussex, WI 53089 United States  (Effective: 10-26-2022)
Prior: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States

8:43 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Jeffery M Schwartz in court.  Attorney Thomas J. Schneck in court for Jeffery M Schwartz.  Prosecuting attorney Randy P. Sitzberger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Schneck provides an update; he notes his client just had a new case filed and has one more Domestic Abuse class to complete.  Atty. Schneck needs time to get a new global resolution with the State and is requesting a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court raises concerns about the defendant complying with court orders, specifically as it relates to alcohol consumption.  Atty. Schneck responds.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for December 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 040223,
Payable Number: 477890,
Receipt Number: 22R 044240,
Amount: $20.00

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery M Schwartz
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W. Moreland Boulevard, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-20-2022)
Prior: W243 N6601 W Haven Dr, Sussex, WI 53089

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Defendant to be released during regular business hours only and is to report directly to Wisconsin Community Services upon release. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM. Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed. Comply with all licensing restrictions. Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services following program protocol for those that are low risk, unless otherwise ordered by the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM monitoring.

2:02 PM Defendant Jeffery M Schwartz in court, in custody.  Attorney Amanda Marie Nimmer, as a friend of the court, in court for Jeffery M Schwartz. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo.   
Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Court advises of right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Initial appearance on October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Initial appearance scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
